Deliver Field Service
Provide Ethical Customer Service
More Service Cloud Features

Use Work Summaries in the Console

Einstein Work Summaries generates an outline of conversations on cases and voice calls. Ask for summaries from the Einstein panel with copilot. For Messaging, Chat, and Voice, you can draft, edit, and save summaries from the Wrap Up component in the Lightning Service Console.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise and Unlimited Editions with the Einstein for Service add-on

USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To view and act on Work Summaries recommendations: Work Summaries User permission set
To access Einstein Copilot: Use Einstein Copilot for Salesforce user
To run prompt templates and use the Summarize Record action: Prompt Template user

Work Summaries for Messaging and Live Chat channels, and Conversation Catch-Up is available in English, French, German, Italian, Japanese, and Spanish. Einstein detects the case language and drafts summaries accordingly.

Einstein Copilot (Beta)

Use natural language to request and save summaries for chat, messaging and voice transcripts from the Einstein panel.

Messaging and Chat, and Voice

You can generate, edit, and save summaries for chat, messaging and voice channels from the Wrap Up component in the Lightning Service Console. Agents can get predictions both during and after the conversation.

Email

Access summaries of emails and email threads from the Einstein Email Summaries component on a case record page.

Mid Conversation

When an agent or supervisor joins or starts monitoring an active voice call or messaging session, the Conversation Catch-Up window appears at the top of the conversation. 

A conversation must have at least 10 text-based entries before a summary can be generated.
title: Work Summaries in Service Cloud
